39417468.review:
[h1]9 Clues, 4 gefunden...[/h1]

Ehrlich gesagt, weiß ich nicht so recht, was ich von dem Spiel halten soll. Ich liebe Wimmelbildspiele. Vor allem liebe ich sie, weil sie meistens eine wunderschöne Grafik haben. Die Grafik von "9 Clues 2: The Ward" stellt mich in dieser Hinsicht nicht zufrieden. Es hat mich regelrecht erschrocken, wie fürchterlich die Charaktere aussehen. Dazu kommt noch, das die Rätsel sehr anspruchslos waren. Ich mag generell eher einfache Rätsel zum Entspannen, aber bei diesen fehlte es doch etwas... Andererseits ist die Story ziemlich spannend gewesen. Es geht um eine Irrenanstalt, einen mysteriösen Hilferuf und Halluzinationen. Passt alles sehr schön zusammen und war auch interessant. Aber für mich hat vor allem die Grafik alles so ein bisschen runtergezogen.

[b]Mein Fazit: Ganz nett für zwischendurch. Story war gut, der Rest unterdurchschnittlich.[/b]

39389748.review:
Autant le premier opus de la série était médiocre, autant ce titre mérite le détour pour qui désire un jeu d'objets cachés sans prise de tête.

Après avoir reçu un appel de détresse en provenance d'un hôpital psychiatrique, nous y débarquons avec notre collègue détective privé A notre arrivée, nous assistons à la défenestration mortelle d'un médecin et à la vue de son bureau dévasté, ce n'est pas un suicide. Ainsi débute notre enquête au sein de cet établissement qui ne va pas tarder à révéler tous ses secrets.


Par rapport au premier "9 Clues", les graphismes ont été revus et quelques mécanismes de gameplay ont été développés.
Néanmoins, les puzzles restent extrêmement faciles et tous les objets seront immédiatement utilisables à proximité.
Considérés au 2ème degré, le scénario et ses rebondissements peuvent distraire.


Convient pour passer le temps durant environ 3h (sans avoir recours aux indices) dans l'atmosphère d'un thriller dans le milieu psychiatrique sans être confronté à la moindre difficulté.

39123558.review:
Artifex Mundi, как ни крути, является своеобразным знаком качества игр в жанре казуального квеста с элементами Hidden Objects. Возможно, все они несколько однообразны, но если их не переедать на ночь, а принимать дозированно, то вполне можно получить удовольствие. 

9 Clues 2: The Ward – не лучший и не худший представитель линейки этого издателя. У него есть свои недостатки, но достоинств намного больше. Не стоит забывать, что это все-таки казуалка, а не полноценный квест, и с этой ролью игра отлично справляется. И, кстати, намного лучше, чем первая часть.

Головоломки, среди которых собственно Hidden Objects встречаются не так уж и часто, пожалуй, даже слишком просты. Зубодробительных моментов не будет в принципе, даже если отключить все подсказки. Однако геймплей и сюжетное повествование выстроены на удивление гармонично. Ничто не раздражает, а приключения местной «Даны Скалли» даже увлекают. 

Интригующая детективная история, разворачивающаяся по большей части в стенах психиатрической лечебницы, очень скоро превратится в психологический триллер с участием оживших пугал, маньяков-пироманов и загадочных убийств по принципу «Десять [strike]негритят[/strike] психотерапевтов решили пообедать». Однако стать мистическим ужастиком ей не суждено, уж слишком мультяшно ведут себя персонажи, а комментарии главной героини и вовсе превращают действие в комедию. И никакого противоречия. На удивление, все очень органично. 

А еще здесь очень легко выбить все ачивки. Правда, для этого потребуется пройти игру как минимум еще раз.

38820463.review:
Durchgespielt!
"Die Anstalt" ist ein kleines aber feines Suchbild Rätselspiel aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi und, so wie fast alle Spiele aus diesem Haus, ein wirklich gutes seiner Art.
Zu Beginn hatte ich sofort den Film "Shutter Island" (wer ihn kennt) im Kopf und fühlte mich ein klein wenig mitten drin.
Die Grafik ist ordentlich und die Musik unterstreicht das Geschehen und die fesselnde Story ausserordentlich gut. 
Rätsel und Suchbilder sind von der soliden Sorte und konnten mich, im Expertenmodus, durchaus gut beschäftigen.
Neu war für mich der, ich nenne ihn mal "den Rekonstruktionsmodus", in welchem man verdächtige und/oder merkwürdige Gegenstände suchen und danach kombinieren muss, um herrauszufinden was vorgefallen ist.
Obwohl ich nicht alle Sammelgegenstände und Archivments gefunden habe, wurde ich dennoch gut unterhalten und kann dieses Spiel nur weiterempfehlen. 
Ich denke dass auch Einsteiger ihre Freude mit diesem Spiel haben werden.

37851155.review:
9 Улик: Безумие – это вторая часть игры по поиску предметов. Разработчики изрядно потрудились над второй частью, и играть стало очень интересно! 
Нужно отметить очень интересный сюжет с интригующей концовкой. Молодая сыщица с помощником прибывают на изолированный остров в психиатрическую клинику. Они получили тревожный звонок оттуда и сразу отправились на помощь. На острове события сразу приобретают серьезный оборот – из окна выпадает один из врачей клиники…
В игре есть три уровня сложности: легкий, средний, эксперт. На выбор вам предоставляется играть либо в классический поиск предметов, либо заменить поиск игрой в маджонг. Но для того чтобы заработать все достижения вам необходимо пройти оба варианта игры. В игре нужно найти фантомные объекты, макеты клиники и символы скрытых улик. Отыскать их не составит особого труда. Также в игре присутствуют головоломки, они не очень сложные, но интересные. Поиск улик представляет собой сбор 9-ти улик на месте неизвестных событий, затем необходимо расставить события по порядку для того чтобы выяснить что же произошло на самом деле. 
Графика в игре находится на достойном уровне, локации хорошо прорисованы и поэтому поиск предметов доставляет сплошное удовольствие. Музыкальное сопровождение также неплохое и поможет вам расслабиться и получить максимум удовольствия от игры. Наличие качественного русского перевода только радует. 
Из минусов нужно отметить корявую анимацию персонажей, а также при описании головоломки про трубы было добавлено описание про сейф. Но в целом эти маленькие недочеты не могут испортить положительное настроение от самой игры.
В игре 39 достижений ,которые получаются за два прохождения. 
Наличие коллекционных карточек.
Оценка 8/10

36324216.review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 5.4h (based on steam, 100% achievement). Note that you need to play the game twice for 100% achievement.
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] Yes (~25 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Developer Response:[/b] Never.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
9 Clues 2: The Ward is a hidden object game about murder in an asylum. Despite of it being a second serie, you can understand the game just fine without playing the first one.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics are decent, although the animation is quite cranky. Some of the animations look like a cropped image of the body that's moved left and right (or up and down) just for the sake of the animation, while the face expression of the characters look like a 3D image on top of 2D body when they talk.

[h1]Music[/h1]
The music creates a spooky atmosphere to the story. The sfx also sounds great, especially for those that's meant for jumpscares. Note that the game doesn't really that scary though; the sfxs are just quite loud and spooky.

[h1]Story[/h1]
To be honest, the story is quite confusing to me at first. However, i understand the story more clearly after playing the game for the second time (although i skipped most of the cutscenes). Some of the story is quite predictable because of the hints of the notes that's laying around the areas, while the details are quite unpredictable. The story itself is quite straightforward with a lot of "mystic" elements in it.

[h1]The game[/h1]
The game is actually just an ordinary hidden object, point and click game where you're supposed to find items and solve the clues. The game itselfs offers in 3 difficulty mode. I played the easiest difficulty and i (obviously) don't have any problem in clearing the game.

The game, just like the story, is quite straightforward and you'll be given several objectives to give you general idea of what you're doing. You also don't need to move between areas too much; you'll only need to move between 3 areas at most to solve an objective. 

The hidden object minigame is decent. Most of the items are hard to notice although you can also click on anything without getting any penalty on the easiest difficulty. If you don't like the hidden object minigame (although it's strange if you're buying this game in the first place), you can also switch the hidden object to mahjong. I honestly enjoyed the mahjong more than the hidden object itself, although it can get too repetitive sometimes. There is also an achievement where you have to play all hidden object and mahjongs, which means that you have to play the game twice to get the acheivements. I find the second playthrough to be boring because i already know what to expect.

There are also some other minigames that's available throughout the game. Some might be tricky while some might be too easy. There is also a skip button if you don't want to deal with it though. However, there is an achievement where you have to finish the game without using a skip button so you might want to reconsider it.

There will also be some hidden collectables in some areas which is carried over if you start a new game, although i doubt it'll matter that much since you'll just check a walkthrough for that one.

Pros:
- 16 hidden objects minigames (or mahjongs)
- Minigames
- Mahjong minigame as an alternative to hidden object

Cons:
- Second playthrough becomes too boring

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is an enjoyable hidden object games that you can try for fun.

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]Buy it when it's on discount and you'll be fine. It's a great time killer.[/i]

35596249.review:
Artifex Mundi-published games nearly always follow the same rote pattern of "literal demon causes havoc and must be defeated using a magic amulet or some nonsense," and I'm generally quite excited when I find one which seems to shake that off.  I should be excited by 9 Clues 2, therefore, whose sole concession to AM's supernatural obsession is clockwork dolls with spinning eyes which can trivially "hypnotise"/brainwash folks into doing just about anything.  Unfortunately, though, I found the setting and execution here to be much worse than the supernatural nonsense they replaced.

Namely, Tap It Games returned to that tired go-to location for "scariness" which is the mental asylum.  Mental illness in this game is treated with the same kind of care and respect as one might afford some rubbish left on the side of the street.  Artifex Mundi characters are always painted with fairly broad strokes, and generally feel "off" in a number of ways as it is, but their portrayal of the patients in the asylum here were, IMO, downright insulting.  I can certainly forgive the "insane villian" trope in a title like this, because what [i]else[/i] would there be in this sort of game, but the portrayal of everyone else is straight out of a 4-year-old's conception of "crazy."  It's telling that by the end of the game, the main characters are slinging slurs like "psycho" and "crazy."

On a technical side, the game is competent as always.  The puzzles benefit, IMO, from having what for Artifex Mundi titles counts as a grounding in reality, and there weren't too many solutions which felt completely arbitrary.  I actually do really like the 9 Clues series's "detective mode" HOB sequences, even though I find their conclusions fairly arbitrary and hilarious most of the time.  The puzzles you encounter are the same rote set found in just about every other AF title, but that can't really count against it.

In the end, it's a competent AF-published title which is let down by its callous and insensitive setting, and offensive portrayal of mental illness.  I guess it's back to the demon-banishing for me!

35590645.review:
这是通关的41个steam游戏了。 我得说，其中起码有十几二十个是artifex mundi制作或发行的游戏，steam上架的它的游戏，大部分都绿了，而入坑作就是9条线索：蛇溪的秘密，一晃都已经三年了。
本作属于中规中矩的解谜游戏，画面还行，谜题合理。剧情始于两个侦探来到一个小岛上的精神病院调查案件，这开头挺像小李子的禁闭岛的。主角还是女的，搭档是男的只会拖后腿，所有关键点都是女主一个人完成的。
游戏地图不大，整个范围都在两层小楼和一个地窖里，而且大部分地点都是东边，西侧房间没几个有剧情的。谜题跟剧情搭配的蛮好，尤其是哪个侦探小游戏，找问号然后排顺序的，虽然我都是根据边框颜色来排序来着。
谜题可能有难的吧，不过对于浸淫am多年的我来说，毫无难度，一趟剧情通关下来，成就解了大部分，除了必须得玩第二遍的麻将成就，只剩下两个隐藏物品的成就。
最后照例得夸一下官方中文。不过这年头steam游戏带中文都成了标配了，似乎不能算优点了。

Me ha gustado muchísimo “9 Clues 2 The Ward”. La verdad, que el juego de “Búsqueda de Objetos”, tiene la historia más oscura, de todos los juegos de Artifex Mundi. 
Las secuencias están más trabajadas, ya que los personajes hablan, y muestran expresiones faciales, relacionadas con sus estados de ánimo.
Posee una notable traducción al castellano, logros, y cromos Steam.
Pero tropieza con los puzles, ya que la mayoría son conocidos, para los seguidores de este estilo de juegos. Y también falla en carecer extras (Fondos, acceso a secuencias, banda sonora, aventura adicional, acceder a los puzles desde el menú).
Pero en su totalidad, me ha dejado una buena experiencia de jugador, y tengo ganas de que publiquen “9 Clues 3” con nuevos puzles, y retomen la trama que quedo sin cerrar, en “9 Clues The Secret of Serpent Creek”.
Si optas a comprar el videojuego, adquiérelo al precio de 1€, formando parte de algún bundle.

35183270.review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

9 Clues 2: The Ward ist ein Wimmelbild-Abenteuer, welches von Tap It Games entwickelt wurde.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Ein junger Detektiv und sein Partner kommen auf einer einsamen, verregneten Insel an. Sie reagieren auf einen verzweifelten Anruf aus der Nervenheilanstalt vor Ort. Als sie allerdings dort eintreffen, besteht die Direktorin darauf, dass es keinen solchen Hilferuf gegeben habe. Nachdem sie Zeuge werden, wie Dr. Crow stirbt, zweifeln sie das jedoch an. Bereits nach kurzer Zeit decken die Detektive bei ihren Ermittlungen Geheimnisse auf, die wohl besser unentdeckt geblieben wären. Jeder neue Hinweis wirft nur noch mehr Fragen auf. Was geht in der Mnemosyne-Anstalt vor sich? Wer hat Dr. Crow getötet? Und was haben die Mitarbeiter und Patienten zu verbergen?Es ist deine Aufgabe, dies herauszufinden. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ teils anspruchsvolle Rätsel 
+ solider Grafikstil 
+ guter Sound
+ schöne Hintergründe
+ mehrere Schwierigkeitsgrade
+ Notizbuch und Karte
+ Hilfefunktion
+ Errungenschaften und Tradingcards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- kurze Spielzeit von 3-4 Stunden

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

9 Clues 2: The Ward ist bislang der grusligste Teil, der fesselnden Serie. Es hat alles, was ein erstklassiger Wimmelbild-Thriller braucht: detailverliebte Animationen, knifflige Minispiele und eine packende Story voller Hochspannung! Klare Kaufempfehlung für Fans dieses Genres.

9 Clues 2: The Ward is one hidden object game from Artifex Mundi publisher. They release usually good and decent HoGs so its not too risky to buy this one if you like this genre of games.

The story is about a young detective who finds herself on an isolated island where suspicious accidents happens. After some investigation you can realize there is a hidden and evil secret behind the doors of the local asylum. Curious now? Lift up the secret by playing the game!

This HoG not just include the usual hidden object puzzles and mini games, you can experience some more entertaining crime scene puzzles aswell.

Artwork is decent and voice acting ok.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill provide some informations about the achievements aswell:
The game include 39 steam achievements. I start straight with the bad news. One playthrough not enough. You can do both on normal/casual difficulty, but in one you need to regular hidden object puzzles, on 2nd you need solve those with mahjong mini games. You also need be fast on hidden objects as you need finish 10 each in 2mins or less. You also need to collect collectible objest on the regular screens.

Skipping cutscenes also not an option if you want all achievements, but why would you any? There is a story to watch!

Time to 100%: 7-9hours

33729942.review:
An extremely good hidden object game, with a fine, solid story, excellent voice acting, and a satisfying denouement. I took particular joy in the fact that one of the characters actually lights up a cigarette during the game. I dunno why. Call it my contrarian nature. Or maybe I just miss my bad habits.

I usually don't buy games on Steam unless they're on sale for at least 65% off, so I got this one at a fair discount. But even without that, it's worth the purchase price. It's got a strong story; although the beginning is a little out-of-the-blue, the rest of it flows and holds together well. The voice acting is excellent, which is rare for an HOG, and the music, although repetitive, isn't intrusive. It's got plenty of achievements, and the hidden object scenes are randomised, so if you want to get 100%, there's some replayability here.

There is at least one jump scare. Maybe three, if you're a particularly nervous sort.

If you're going for all the side quests (the morphing objects, the ? marks, and the pieces of the asylum model, you CAN replay with the same user and just pick up the ones you missed in the first playthrough. All the objects are straightforward finds, if you're paying close attention to the environments.

Pros:

+ good voice acting.
+ powerful story.
+ Mr Mittens!
+ replayability.
+ map with notations.
+ beautiful graphics.
+ complex characters.
+ sensible, logical mini-games.
+ morphing objects, ? marks, pieces of an asylum model.
+ hate HOGs? play Mahjong instead. 
+ achievements.
+ trading cards.

Cons:

- the music can be a bit repetitive.
- the nurse's cutesy voice can be a little irritating.

Ephy Rating: 9/10

Summary: This is one of the better HOGs out there, despite the fact that it's a 2015 game. The graphics are good, the voice acting is good, the story is tight, and the gameplay is solid. Even if it's not on sale, this one is worth the purchase price. Give Mr Mittens a hug for me.

[h1]【概要】[/h1]

そして調査するために孤島の精神病院へやってきた。

オールドタイプのポイントクリック。

最後には驚く展開がありますし、王道ストーリーで楽しめました。
また、おじさん受けによかったです。

32002808.review:
[i]Mieux réussi que son prédécesseur.[/i]

[b]9 Clues 2: The Ward[/b], sorti en 2015, est un Hidden Objects où l'on incarne un détective qui reçoit un appel inquiétant depuis un asile. Vous arrivez donc sur les lieux.

[h1]Les plus :[/h1]

- L'histoire est déjà un peu plus intéressante que le 1er. Mieux réalisée. Peut-être est-ce l'aura que procure un asile, qui sait ?
- Les énigmes sont plus réussies et diverses.
- La bande-son est très bonne. Autant pour les voix que la musique.
- Les graphismes sont aussi très bons. On notera une amélioration des cinématiques, ainsi qu'une synchronisation labiale dans les dialogues, les rendant plus vivant.
- Une durée de vie respectable pour un HO. Entre 3-5h pour finir le jeu. Comptez une deuxième partie pour faire le 100% succès.

[h1]Les moins :[/h1]

- Les phases HO sont encore trop faciles.
- Je ne vois pas trop le rapport [spoiler][strike]avec la Bretagne ?[/strike][/spoiler] avec le premier opus ? Ce ne sont même pas les mêmes personnages principaux, et de mémoire, la fin du 1er jeu faisait penser qu'il y aurait une suite..

[h1]N.B. :[/h1]

- Evaluation de [i]9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/i] --> [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Kazadrur/recommended/284870/]Voir ici[/url]

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

N'ayant pas du tout aimé le premier, je partais un peu sceptique pour le deuxième opus. Au final, quasiment tous les défauts du 1er ont été corrigés, en faisant un jeu d'Objets Cachés respectable. A prendre au solde.

_ _ _ _

[h1]Si vous avez trouvé cette évaluation utile, et que vous voulez en discuter autour d'un verre, venez rejoindre notre [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AlternaTyff#curation]page de curation et nos forums ![/url][/h1]

31948315.review:
Ce n'est pas le meilleur des jeux d'Objets Cachés auquels j'ai joué. Toutefois, il remplit clairement son objectif de vous divertir simplement pendant 3 bonnes heures (en mode Expert). Artifex Mundi se débrouille en général bien dans ce genre de jeu, actuellement je trouve la série des Enigmatis la plus réussie.

Le 1er opus des "9 clues" m'avait semblé un peu plus inspiré, celui-ci représente une autre aventure avec le même personnage principal mais le scénario est très classique, sans surprises.

A noter que les scènes d'objets cachés ne sont pas omniprésentes (8 tableaux et on les utilise 2 fois = 16), c'est une bonne idée de laisser plus de place au reste. A titre personnel je n'ai pas trouvé les autres puzzles bien difficiles.

Un jeu "casual", sans révolution scénaristique ou graphique, une bande son agréable, une durée de vie un peu courte, à prendre comme tel, et à très petit prix (souvent en promotion avec d'autres).

31831391.review: The first 9 Clues game had very questionable quality in many aspects, but this game has no continuity with the first one, and is a solid detective HOG. While its far from a perfect HOG, it's decent and I had fun playing. If you're hesitant to buy because you weren't fond of the first 9 Clues game, this one is much different and far better. Pick it up on sale if you want a new hidden object game.

31137140.review:
I really like the 9 Clues series. Yes some of their stories and characters are a little twee but the game trips along quite nicely and usually has a compelling storyline to keep you interested. Puzzles are generally at the right pitch to have some challenge but not be too mindboggling so that you get stuck. Finding additional items you might have missed also helps with the replayability.

My one criticism would the the optional mahjong game in place of hidden objects. I really liked this alternative game idea in one of their earlier games as it means that if you get hidden object fatigue there is still a way of playing through the game. However this one is a grind as the mahjong is very easy, and there is no way to lose as it just resets itself. There are much better versions of alternative to hidden object mini games and some variety would be very welcome. Other than that, though, a nice little game.

30965058.review:
Игра в целом оставляет хорошее впечатление, хотя и она не без грехов. Из положительных сторон могу отметить интересный сюжет, который проходится на одном дыхании. Я обожаю детективные игры в жанре point&click и очень жду от них именно захватывающей истории, чего-то необычного, а не простое хождение, поиск предметов и банальный сюжет, который до боли предсказуем. В 9 Clues 2: The Ward чего стоит одна концовка, о которой в начале игры даже предположить нельзя. 
Также отдельно хочется похвалить и поругать одновременно за "Детективный уровень". Кто играл в серии игр про Шерлока, думаю, вспомнит, что там была возможность по уликам восстановить события, которые произошли на месте преступления и потом даже посмотреть все, что происходило. Тут тоже можно так сделать, но, блин, в Шерлоке ты выстраиваешь последовательность исходя из своей логики и догадок, строишь линию истории и смотришь ее так, как бы это делал реальный детектив. Здесь же ты картинки ставишь так, ЧТОБ ФОН СОВПАЛ СЗАДИ, а дальше героиня тебе вообще непонятно по какой логике выстроит собития, причем так точно, будто она там стояла, когда человека резали. Ну что это такое?
И самое грустное. Разработчики, как вы вообще придумали анимировать лица 3D к тому же так коряво, когда у вас фигуры персонажей да и весь мир в целом ПЛОСКИЙ И СТАТИЧНЫЙ? Это реально выглядит отвратительно лично для меня. Что за плоские трупы у вас в игре? Раз вы требуете за нее 219 р., то будьте добры сделать ее визульно качественной. (стоит отметить, что, например, компания Jetdogs Studios свои игры данного жанра делает с полностью 3D персонажами, очень красивой картинкой и плавной анимацией. Cursed их игра, вышедшая в те же временные рамки, что и  9 Clues 2: The Ward стоит всего 129 р.) 
Не знаю, насколько будет забавным этот факт, но у меня в одной сцене, когда напарник на кровати лежал, у него пропала голова во время диалога.
Итог: со скидкой игру купить можно и, думаю, вам она понравится. На все косяки можно закрыть глаза, ведь сюжет здесь достойный. А для меня это главное.

30768530.review:
Пролетая над гнездом кукушки.
Я не такой большой специалист в жанре "Hidden Object", поэтому сравнивать "9 Clues 2 - The Ward" с другими играми этого жанра я не смогу.
Однако могу смело сказать, что игра мне очень понравилась.
В ней есть оригинальный и хорошо поданный сюжет, куча вещей и мелочей, которые отрисованы с завидной скрупулезностью. Имеется качественная озвучка игровых персонажей, красивая рисованная графика, удобное управление и отсутствие каких-либо багов и тупняков.
Загадки в ней очень интересные, разнообразные и очень хорошо продуманные. Есть куча игровых достижений - и некоторые из них можно выбить только с 2-3 прохождения. Карточки игровые падают - я вона себе фойл выбил за 742 рубля!
В-общем, для ознакомления с жанром "Hidden Object" настоятельно рекомендую - однако брать советую лишь по скидке (впрочем, как и все остальные игры подобного жанра). Лично я потратил на прохождение игры (в легком режиме) 3 часа - и пролетели они мигом! Для одного-двух приятных вечеров вполне себе сносно.

30532465.review:
Je m'attendais à tort à une suite directe du 1er 9 Clues mais il n'en est rien. 
Mis à part l'héroine et son partenaire qui ne vous seront pas totalement inconnus si vous avez joué au 1er volet, le scénario quant à lui raconte une toute autre histoire et cela permet dans un sens de pouvoir jouer à ce jeu sans forcément avoir fait son prédécesseur.
L'ambiance fantastique/horreur et les graphismes dessins/BD restent dans la lignée du 1er 9 Clues et cette sensation de nostalgie d'être en pleine lecture d'un roman "Chair de Poule" est toujours aussi présente même si un côté peut être un peu adulte ressort dans le scénario de ce second volet.
9 Clues 2 reste avant tout un agréable petit Hidden Object ni très long, ni très compliqué mais l'ajout d'un mode alternatif de Mahjong aux phases d'objets cachés augmente tout de même sa durée de vie, d'autant plus si vous êtes du genre chasseur de succès. Les phases de gameplay "analyse de lieu/scènes de crime" ont elles aussi été améliorées par rapport au 1er du nom.
En résumé, on sent un réel souhait de la part des créateurs de la license d'étoffer les 9 Clues et c'est un pari gagné car rien qu'à travers ce deuxième opus, on sent déjà que le jeu a grandi.

30416008.review:
[u]Tap It Games[/u] brings back a second chapter in the life of a detective that together with Owen receive a strange phone call for help. The signal traces back to Mnemosyne Asylum, where mysterious phenomena are happening!
The developers reunite everything they learn from the previous game, and create a unique masterpiece that is a must among any fan of adventure games.

[b]9 Clues 2: The Ward[/b] is still placed in the 50's, but this time in Mnemosyne Asylum. Home for all sorts of mental patients and their staff, but things take a different turn when a mysterious killer starts leaving a trail of dead bodies as we progress in our investigation. It will take courage and a smart mind to clear all the secrets in this ward.
If the first game was predicted in every possible way, the second game involves the player in a fantastic plot, that is as unpredicted as brilliant. 

The artwork remains the same, with a nice hand touch to the scenarios and a great design for objects overall. Because we have more areas to discover, we also have a large variety of sets available, but the atmosphere remains the same. 
This time around if you feel that Hidden Objects are not your cup of tea you can avoid them by playing a game of Mahjong! Don't worry though, thankfully this version is not only fun, but is as simple as it can be, and for a change it's interesting to have the option.
The Clue system previously presented in the first game made it back into the Ward, and this time with improvements, adding an extra puzzle to it, and a cool cutscene of the events.
Despise Owan being back and of course, ending up seriously injured as well, the player can collect several events adding to your fun as an achievement hunter!

With a superb storyline, a plot worth of one the best HO's game I ever played, this is a must for everyone who likes a cool adventure in a mix of insanity!
8/10

29789837.review:
Do you want a game that uses every "Crazy Person" cliche ever created? This is for you! We have your "crazy people are murderous", "clearly sane people being locked up for flimsy reasons", "crazy people are just giant children", "crazy people are stupid", "hypnotisim is magic" and many more!

The protagonists make one dumb decision after another. Sometimes they change it up with a horrifically unethical decision that's portrayed as not being all that bad because at least they had good intentions. 

*MAJOR SPOILERS* Keeping a tiny, completely sane orphan in the asylum with the criminally insane was bad enough. After all, if you think of the ORPHAN as your daughter then surely there is no way to keep the ORPHAN with you unless you keep her commited. It's not like she's an ORPHAN from an ORPHANAGE that would like to maybe give her up for adoption. No, makes much more sense to keep her in the building with the murderer, right.

*SPOILERS CONTINUE* But then it gets even stupider when you meet the person murdering everyone and then reveal that they've been manipulated. Somehow the fact that they were lied to trumps the fact that they just violently murdered four people and assaulted others. Oh boo hoo, your revenge was ruined beacuse you killed the wrong people, no you're not free to go! Player character, stop sympathizing! Also, what part of "there's a bomb, we need to leave" was so hard to understand? Have the emotional connection with the goddamn violent murderer after you leave!

SPOILERS ENDED

Ignoring the unspeakably awful plot for a moment: the mechanics work well, there's three kinds of hidden object to discover, and minimal glitches (the wheelchair disappearing was a big one though). It's a fairly good HOG, mechanically speaking.

In case you couldn't tell, this game pissed me the hell off. I know HOGs aren't known for their writing, but this was so bad it inspired me to write my second ever review. At least I got all the achievements and don't ever have to think about this Thing again.

I'm going to go eat some chocolate and pet an animal. Christ.

缺点：
1、部分谜题过于简单，印象中没有一个场景能困住人两分钟以上。

可以一玩的+1游戏，打折入包可以出手，全价的话就算了吧。

不得不说，系列第二作给了我很大的惊喜。
首先，剧情上有了很大的进步，不会像第一作一样让我5分钟就知道最终BOSS是谁，虽然游戏后期剧情有些收的太快，尤其是护士的突然反水。
其次，全程配音上比前作也强不少，当然。。不包括女主角。
再次，或许是我的错觉。。我感觉这作比前作画面好了一些。
最后说一下我觉得不足的地方：
首先，谜题仍旧非常的简单，乃至于谜题类型和前作比没有什么变化，尤其是和很出彩的线索谜题对比情况下。
其次，增加麻将游戏是个不错的点子。但是在实际游戏里，简单的找物反而把麻将游戏衬托的困难不少。这就比较尴尬了。
最后，就不能添加通关奖励关卡吗。。。
最后总结一下：一部不错的作品，别的不说，光这非常棒的汉化就值得入手了。

29025577.review:
I'll give this a "recommended" not because it's good but because it's better than some HO games I've played, but that's still not saying much. The story was actually pretty intriguing and left some questions until near the end, which is surprising. None of the puzzles were rage-inducing, which is always a plus, and the HO minigames were well done. I can't complain too much about the difficulty level. And the graphical quality is up to par with some of the better HO games that are out there.

Now we come to the voice acting. That seems to be hit or miss with a lot of these games, and this one runs the gamut from "surprisingly good" for a few characters to "OMG my ears are bleeding" for the rest (including the black nurse and the lead character) all in one game! VO quality is annoyingly inconsistent, and those characters that are badly voiced are really atrocious. "Wooden" is being generous. 

And of course Tap It Games is taking after Artifex Mundi by forcing you to play at least two run-throughs in order to get all of the achievements by making you choose between the HO games and mahjongg. No, thank you. The voice acting alone is going to stop me from doing that, thankyouverymuch.

So, this is by no means the worst HO game I've ever played, but - wow - the voice acting made it difficult to push through sometimes.

28270142.review:
Znana z poprzedniej części bohaterka powiększyła swoją agencję o człowieka, którego poznała podczas rozwiązywania poprzedniej sprawy. Pewnego dnia otrzymują telefon z zakładu dla psychicznie chorych. Nie dość, że samo zlecenie zabrzmiało tajemniczo, to wspomniany zakład mieści się na odciętej od świata wyspie, zaś jego przeszłość może napawać niepokojem. Na dodatek po dotarciu na miejsce rozpętuje się sztorm. Od tej pory gra jest nasza.

Przyznam, że dawno nie widziałem tak koncertowo spieprzonej opowieści przy tak fajnym settingu. Myślałem, że tylko pierwsza część zawiera oczywistego złego, że tutaj tego błędu nie powtórzą. Pardon, ale już kreskówki o Scooby-doo miały lepiej ukryte tożsamości łotrów. W The Ward nawet zgadując, kto za tym wszystkim stoi, nie da się pomylić. Jakby tego było mało, w trakcie rozgrywki fabuła jest tak pełna klisz, że połowę sytuacji da się przewidzieć na długo przed ich pojawieniem się.

Zagadki, wliczając w to sekwencje hidden object – trzon tego typu produkcji – są nijakie. Do tego stopnia, że jak zacząłem je rozwiązywać, pędziłem na złamanie karku i ani się obejrzałem, a gra się skończyła. Zabrakło chyba tylko zagadki z kluczem po drugiej stronie drzwi. Normalnie gratulacje, 4 godziny grania na poziomie ekspert. Nawet mini przygody nie ma.

Graficznie The Ward niby stoi na tym samym poziomie, co poprzednie, opisane przeze mnie tytuły wydane przez Artifex Mundi, ale nawet ten element wypada mdło. Ponownie, jest to chyba pierwszy raz, gdy nudziłem się w psychiatryku w grze. Jedynym aspektem, do którego nie mogę się przyczepić, jest muzyka. Ścieżka dźwiękowa jest naprawdę dobra i pasowałaby do klimatu, gdyby nie to, że tylko muzyk odrobił pracę domową.

9 Clues 2 jest słaby i nie polecam go nikomu. Spaprana historia, przeciętna wizja szpitala psychiatrycznego, nudne i proste zagadki, krótki czas gry. Moja ocena w skali szkolnej: 2.

http://kresowyblog.blogspot.com/2015/12/9-clues-2-ward.html

28239315.review:
My only experience with hidden object games was the really cheap ones that you find at restaraunts on the computers for children. Those are typically timed and just a massive cluster of items crammed on the screen. So, it took me a while before I decided to play this one.

I have to say... I'm more than pleasantly surprised. Not only is this a well built game, it has a fairly decent story and hidden objects is just one of the many puzzles that this game has you go through. The puzzles were never really that hard, and all the objects that you need are typically in the room that you've been placed into. But the interesting story and simplicity kept me going.

Positives:
The atmosphere of this game is wonderful, and I never felt very lost on what to do.
The story is predictable, but still enjoyable.
Option to skip hidden object segements by playing mahjongg instead

Mixed:
I don't really remember the music, which means it was neither terrible nor breath taking.

Negatives:
The user interface is never explained.
The graphics are sub-par. This is most apparent with animation, as instead of having full animation, they have animated faces super imposed onto static images. All the dialogue is voice acted, but I would think either friends volunteered to do the voices or the actors weren't paid very much.

27975844.review:
[h1]Этот обзор - моё личное мнение!

ОПИСАНИЕ[/h1]

Классическая игра в жанре "Hidden Object", со своими загадками и прочими деталями, но обо всём по порядку.
Мы играем за детектива, которому неожиданно звонят по телефону и просят срочно помочь, вы быстро прибываете на место, а это одинокий остров на котором расположена психиатрическая клиника. Когда мы подходим к владелице клиники, то она говорит, что это была ошибка и тут всё в порядке, но неожидано из окна выпадает человек и тут начинаются основные события.
В этой игре в отличии от подобных есть одно нововведение - это поиск улик. В определённой сцене, где неизвестно, что произошло, нам надо собрать 9 улик и раставить события по порядку. Как и во всех играх данного жанра тут надо искать предметы, ращгадывать кучу загадок, и искать нужные предметы.

 [h1]ПЛЮСЫ[/h1]

- Не плохой сюжет.
- Хорошая музыка.
- Головоломки на которыми надо подумать.

[h1]МИНУСЫ[/h1]

- Проходится довольно быстро.
- Непонятная концовка.

[h1]ИТОГ[/h1]

Не самая лучшая, но и не самая худшая игра данной студии. Рекомендую всем, кому нравиться жанр остальным играть если только очень захотелось, но и тем и другим могу сказать, что покупать лучше всего по скидке.
Моя оценка игре 7.5/10
С уважением, "m@x!m0v" -  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/yoursight] "your sight ". [/url]

27004657.review:
6.9/10 - Artifex Mundi; Kings of Recycling Plots and Story Format!

I don't typically love Hidden Object games, but Artifex Mundi always seems 
to do a great job. This latest game is pretty solid, nothing new or earth shattering
but gets the job done. It took about 4 hours to complete this for me; trying not to use
any help or cheats. Fail.

The story follows a woman detective and her partner Owen; they are sent to investigate some
reported disturbances at the local sanitarium. Upon arrival, a therapist's falls to their
death triggering a heated investigation which ultimately will test the detectives wits and push them 
to the limit. 

Pretty awesome for a Hidden Object game. Just OKAY in the overall scheme of things. It was a pretty straightforward, recycled theme not really provoking an emotional response but good enough to finish. There isn't much of the usual backtracking so I really could appreciate the game to it's fullest!

Overall, worth 4-5$; total campaign is 4 hours. Pay Accordingly.

26605433.review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 8/10

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 3,5 Stunden für einen Durchgang auf höchstem Schwierigkeitsgrad

[b]Zusammenfassung:[/b]
+ interessante u. spannende Geschichte
+ Sammelkarten
+ gut erreichbare Errungenschaften (erfordern aber ein zweites Mal durchspielen) 
+ alternativ zum Beenden der Wimmelbildszenen können diese durch Mahjong gelöst werden (für die Errungenschaften benötigt man aber beides)
+ Schnellreisefunktion per Karte 

+/- recht düstere Geschichte

- kleinere Grafikfehler, wie verschwundene Köpfe bei Charakteren, verschwundene Rollstühle
- gerade am Anfang Rechtschreib- u. Grammatikfehler 
- Textbalken im oberen Bereich sind sehr groß 

[b]Kommentar:[/b] 
„9 Glues 2: The Ward“ hat mich positiv überrascht. Ich hatte geringere Erwartungen an dieses Spiel, weil sein Vorgänger [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284870/]9 Glues: The Secret of Serpent Creek[/url] nicht zu meinen Lieblingsspielen aus der Artifex Mundi Kollektion gehört. 

Normalerweise ist es so, dass ich ein Wimmelbildspiel nur dann starte, wenn ich Lust zu rätseln (und zu wimmeln) habe. Es ist mir jedoch das erste Mal passiert, dass die Rätsel und Suchszenen plötzlich nebensächlich wurden, weil ich unbedingt wissen wollte, wie die Geschichte weiter geht. 
Um es kurz zu machen: Die Story ist interessant, spannend und bis zum Schluss habe ich nicht gewusst, wer der Mörder ist. [b]Aber[/b] sie ist für Artifex Mundi Verhältnisse recht düster. Ich finde das nicht schlimm. Ich wollte jedoch darauf hinweisen, dass dieses Spiel eventuell nicht für sehr junge Spieler geeignet ist. 

Grafik und Musik sind auf einem guten Niveau. Grafik und Musik sind nicht mit einem Spiel wie [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284850]Grim Legends[/url] vergleichbar. Aber alles wirkt stimmig und ist die meiste Zeit sehr angenehm anzusehen und anzuhören. Einen Ausreißer gibt es aber dennoch: Nämlich den Strafbildschirm, wenn man in den Suchszenen zu oft daneben klickt. Dieser ist verpixelt, schwammig und lieblos gestaltet. 
Die Animationen sind teilweise etwas ruckelig, besonders wenn die Charaktere sich bewegen. 

Die Qualität des Voice Actings ist durchwachsen. Es gibt einige gute Sprecher und einige schlechtere, die sehr unmotiviert klingen. Davon sollte man sich aber nicht abschrecken lassen, sonst würde man ein gutes Spiel verpassen. (Eine der Stimmen, die ich am Anfang ganz schrecklich fand, besserte sich auch im Laufe der Zeit und machte gegen Ende auf eine verschrobene Weise sogar Sinn.) 

Rästel und Wimmelbilder sind eher leicht in diesem Spiel. Es gibt ganz wenige, die etwas komplizierter sind und die meisten können durch einfaches ausprobieren gelöst werden. Viele Rätsel sind meist auch bekannt aus anderen Wimmelbildspielen. 

Es gibt wenige direkte Kritikpunkte von mir: 
Wie bei allen neueren Spielen von Artifex Mundi sind auch hier die Textbalken sehr groß. Und wie immer störe ich mich daran. Ich persönlich finde, dass sie zu viel vom Bildschirm verdecken und nehme sie als sehr störend war, wenn ich den oberen Teil der Szenerie absuchen möchte.

Gelegentlich sind mir kleinere Grafikfehler über den Weg gelaufen. Ein Rollstuhl verschwand und verschiedene Charaktere standen plötzlich ohne Kopf da. Wenn ich mir die anderen Reviews ansehe, dann scheint das Problem häufiger zu sein. 

Für etwas geübtere Wimmelbildspieler sind die meisten Errungenschaften bekannt und leicht zu erreichen, da man diese praktisch während des Durchspielens mitnimmt. Das Spiel muss für 100 % zwei Mal durchgespielt werden. Zudem sollte man jede Szene sehr aufmerksam betrachten, denn es gibt gleich 3 Errungenschaften für versteckte Gegenstände und Symbole. 

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] Wer Wert auf ein Wimmelbildspiel mit einer guten Geschichte legt, sollte sich dieses unbedingt ansehen. Wie bei fast allen Wimmelbildspielen empfinde ich den Vollpreis als etwas zu hoch, daher würde ich raten auf ein Angebot zu warten. Vorkenntnisse aus dem ersten Teil werden für das Spiel nicht benötigt.

25911568.review:
Vannak műfajok amikben nem vagyok annyira otthon, ilyen például a point & click vagy a hidden object is. Nincsenek ellenemre az ilyen játékok, de nem játszok annyit ilyennel, hogy túl sok viszonyitási alapom legyen. Viszont most akadt egy hidden object játék is kezem közé, és élveztem is, hogy miért azt lentebb olvashatjátok. 

A stílusa tetszett nagyon, legalábbis a grafikai megjelenítés terén. Viszonylag élénk színeket használtak a helyszínek megrajzolásakor, illetve elég hangulatosra és stílusosra sikerült úgy az egész. A helyszíne egy igazi klasszikus bolondokháza lett, régi odon épület, szerintem megadja az alaphangulatot. A hangok nem rosszak, viszont a voic acting-al annyira nem voltam már kibékülve. Igaz mindegyik karakter elég jellegzetes lett, de nekem kicsit túltolt lett ez az egész. Inkább a sztereotípiák felé mentek el a karakterek hangjaiban.

A játékmenetben meg nem nagyon lehet hibázni igazából. Amerre kattintunk arra tartunk. A nézőpont nekem kicsit szokatlan volt (bár nem ismerem a műfajt annyira), mivel a főhös szemeivel látunk mindent. Nekem ez kicsit furcsa volt egy ilyen játéknál. De ez inkább amiatt lehet, hogy nem igen játszottam még ilyen stílusú játékkal. A szobákban mozogni nem tudunk csak a szobák között. Tárgyakat kell keresgélnünk, aprobb rejtvényeket kell megoldanunk (pl. minimális matek feladatok, kép kirakos feladatok, keresd meg a tárgyat feladatok, aprobb logikai feladatok, stb.), semmi bonyolult nincs benne. De ha elakadnánk vagy csak szimplán nem tudnánk merre kell mennünk akkor van egy "Segítség" gombunk (Hint) amire kattintva egy kicsit segít a játék nekünk. (Ja igen Mahjongozással kiválthatóak a tárgykeresős feladatok.) Plusz van egy naplónk amibe a nyomozónk mindent feljegyez az egyes személyekkel kapcsolatban.

A sztori nem rossz egyébként, egy klasszikus gyilkosos krimi történetet kapunk. Apróbb fordulatok vannak benne, de igazából hamarabb össze lehet rakni a képet mint ahogy a dolgok kiderülnek, de ez nem feltétlen baj. Végig élvezetes lett, ennek ellenére is. Egyébként nagyjából 3-4 órát kell egy végigjátszásra számolni. Ez nem túl sok, de azt hiszem egy ilyen jellegű játéknál pont elég. Ha hosszabb lenne, valószinűleg unalomba fulladna. 

Plusz ként kapunk gyűjtögethető tárgyakat, amikért achievementek járnak. És ha achievementek akkor meg kell említenem hogy nem nehéz az összeset összeszedni (tipp, hint gombra ne kattintsatok és akkor 1 végigjátszás alatt össze szedhető az összes). Aki erre pályázik annak érdmes a rejtett tárgyakért utmutatókat néznie. Steam-es kártyákat természetesen itt is kapunk. 

Összeségében abszolút nem egy rossz játék, aki szereti a hidden object játékokat annak bátran tudom ajánlani. Mivel maga a játék rövid, így 8 euróért nem feltétlen érdemes megvenni. De a műfaj szerelmeseinek még így is megérheti. A mechanikában nincsenek problémák (nem bugos a hitbox pl.), és a stílusa is egész korrekt neki. Ha kicsit nagyobb csavar lenne a sztoriban, vagy erősebb lenne az, a voic acting pedig jobb lenne, akkor simán 10/10-es lenne a műfaján belül szerintem. Így nálam csak 7-ast kap, ennek ellenére ajánlani tudom.

7/10

The second game in the 9 Clues series by Tap It Games and Artifex Mundi steps up in quality in a case of the sequel being even better than the original. The thematic consistency with regards to gameplay mechanics and collectibles is awesome.

24609356.review:
[h1]Short version: 73%[/h1]
The incredibly bad voice-acting may scare away a few players, but if we look past that, then we find a decent hidden object game with the usual Artifex Mundi style puzzles and a solid, interesting murder mystery.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
9 Clues 2: The Ward is more like a spiritual successor, rather than something that tries to continue Serpent Creek’s story. Heck, the game even tries its best to either completely avoid the events of its predecessor or just downplay it as some hallucination.

The plot it a much more straightforward crime story instead, where our detective and her partner try to investigate a series of murders at an asylum. As far as casual game detective stories go, this one is a solid job, with predictable killer and a few enjoyable minor twists here and there. Sadly, the cringe-worthy voice-acting can hurt the quality.

For game mechanics… well, apart from the return of the detective mode (which is sort of a reverse hidden object scene), there are only a handful of easy scenes and a few stock puzzles. I cannot say that the game really tries to shower the player with too much to do, pushing completion time around two hours at best, with no bonus chapter.

24578954.review:
[h1]HOG 게임으로서 가성비가 좋은 게임[/h1]

가성비 기준을 어디에 두느냐에 따라 생각하는 관점이 다를수도 있지만 히든 오브젝트 게임으로서 도전과제 수도 많은 편이고 기본 3시간 정도의 분량으로 너무 짧지도 너무 길지도 않은 적정 수준의 런닝타임으로 도전과제도 달성하기가 쉬운 게임이다. 도전과제를 모두 완성하기 위해서는 2회차 이상을 플레이 해야 하는데, 도전과제 중에 1분 안에 숨은그림을 찾아라거나 실수하지 않고 숨은그림찾기를 하라는 그런 도전과제는 없어서 타 게임에 비해서는 상당히 수월한 편이다. 게임의 스토리도 괜찮은 게임이다.

다만, 한가지 힌트를 전혀 사용하지 않고 게임을 끝내라는 도전과제가 있긴한데, 이런 게임에 익숙해져있는 유저라면 힌트를 전혀 사용하지 않고 엔딩보기란 그렇게 쉬운 일은 아니지만 2회차를 기본으로 하는 게임으로서 1회차에서 힌트를 사용해서 엔딩을 보고 2회차를 연속해서 하면 조금 나을것이라 생각한다. 그리고 요즘에는 유튜브도 있으니 정 모를시에 유튜브 영상 등을 참고해서 플레이하는 것도 나쁘지는 않다. 그리고 찾아야 할 조각이나 문양등은 가이드를 참고하면 쉽게 할수 있을 것이다.

아티펙스 먼디에서 직접 제작한 게임들이 대체적으로 고퀄리티를 자랑하는 경우가 많은데, 아티펙스 먼디에서 퍼즐리셔만 한 게임으로서 비밀결사단 시리즈와 함께 괜찮은 수준의 게임이라고 할수 있다. ₩ 10,500원의 가격 값어치는 충분히 하는 게임이다.
유저들의 평도 상당히 좋은 편이라 앞으로 후속작 나올 것으로 예상되는 시리즈이다.

65번째 도전과제 100% 달성한 게임.
(2016년 7월 28일 오전 1시 49분에 달성)

[i]Я не такая уж большой специалист в жанре "Hidden Object", поэтому сравнивать [b]9 Clues 2 - The Ward[/b] с другими играми этого жанра я не могу.

В ней есть оригинальный, хорошо подданный сюжет, куча вещей и мелочей, прорисованных с завидной скрупулезностью. Также имеется качественная озвучка игровых персонажей, красивая графика, удобное управление и отсутствие каких бы то ни было багов.
Загадки в игре также весьма интересные, разнообразные и хорошо продуманные. Есть множество игровых достижений, некоторые из которых можно выбить только со второго, либо с третьего прохождения. Карточки падают - я себе даже фойл выбила за 742 рубля.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

9 Clues 2: The Ward is a sequel of 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek featuring a new case independent from the first one. 

Despite his little brother 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek was one of the less stunning (graphics) of Artifex Mundi, graphics are really awesome for this brand new sequel.

If you played the game before (first one) you’ll already know the two main characters: you (a young female detective) and her partner Owen Duffer. One day you receive a distress call from a psychiatric hospital: Mnemosyne Asylum on a secluded island. But upon your arrival, one of the hospital’s therapists falls out of the window to his death. Then begin a thrilling adventure and investigation about a serial killer on this secluded asylum. You’ll slowly discover everything about the past of Mnemosyne Asylum as well as all member of the asylum staff and some patients. The story remembers me a lot Batman : Arkham Asylum and the scarecrow and I loved that ! Adding to the story and graphics the voices are pretty good and make this game looks perfect. Now let’s talk about the gameplay.

As every Artifex Mundi game you can move freely in different area (of Mnemosyne Asylum) and need to solve some puzzles and find all objects in hidden objects scenes. The game has 3 difficulties and a guest feature: every one of the family can play an independent save and resume the game where they left it. When you first play the game you’ll have a notebook where you have all your objectives as well as all your notes. You’ll also have a map to not get lost and be able to fast travel with hit. Adding to that you’ll have a hint button that will help you in many ways but be warned that you may not use it at all during one of your playthrough to get an achievement. Hints can be used to know where you need to go, where is the next interaction or to show an object or clue in an HOS or IS or to skip a puzzle.

As some Artifex Mundi games you are able to play mahjong to skip a HO scene, I suggest you to play it on your second playthrough though. While playing the mahjong you need to remove all tiles in order to skip the HO scene, especially the golden theater masks tiles. To remove tiles you need to match 2 same tiles but you can only match tiles that are available: above the others or on the sides.

One of the very good thing of this game is that there are 2 (almost) unique features you won’t find in any other Artifex Mundi game:

•	You’ll have several Investigation scenes which come independently from the hidden object scenes. With a remastered concept of the first game. (like Crime Secrets)
•	You’ll need to find asylum model fragments scattered through the game.  (achievement)

To talk about the investigation scene: you see the current scene where there are many clues more or less obvious. You need to find every of them without the name or type of each clue. (If you play on an easier mode your cursor will glow when you are close to a clue) Then you need to place the evidence in the right order: that’s a linear puzzle where you need to order each tile to have the correct shape. After that you unlock a cut scene where you see how the events have happened.

During your journey to the asylum you’ll find many asylum model fragments which will show you the current model view in an extra menu. Adding to that there are also 2 others collectibles: the 9 clues and the morphing objects. The 9 clues are 9 hidden question tag/mark that will reveal a part of your investigation. Finally the morphing items will appears as you proceed through your investigation: delusion that appears half of the time. 

 (*) : 
In addition to no skip or use any hint while playing every puzzles and Hidden objects scenes, there are more missable achievements. Some are obvious but can still be missed : finish the game without using hints at all or watch all cut scenes without skipping any of them.
Some are more challenging and ask you to solve 5 puzzles or 5 HO in under 5 minutes each. Another requires you to finish 3 mahjong in a row without shuffling the tiles. Then you have the collectibles : asylum model fragments, 9 clues, morphing items, information about the characters. For the first three collectibles I suggest you to follow a guide on steam.

Finally if you missed anything while finishing your first playthrough, you’ll still be able to get them on your second playthrough. Indeed you need to play the story a second time to get all the mahjong achievements. Also achievements are linked to your profile: you can track your achievement in-game so the good thing is you only need to succeed where you failed : meaning that if you failed to find 1 clue among the 9 : you just need to succeed the only one which is missing. But only if you replayed the story without making a new profile.

24296670.review:
Done by these developers http://tapitgames.com/index.php

A h.o.g (hidden object game) that continues on vaguely form the first. I say vaguely because the first one hardly ever took itself seriously and almost had a goofy scoobydoo type feel for it. This one on the other hand from get go launches a much more adult subject and story line and tries somewhat to mimic a 'shutter island' type of adventure.

The story begins with you getting asked by someone to investigate a secluded assylum. When you get there you get greeted with a 'nothing to see here go back' only to have someone immediately commit suicide in front of you. From that point on you begin to realise that there must be some really crazy people in there and there is. One of the most disturbing I came across was a guy whose whole life ambition must be to become a 'crazy cat lady'. The art room was full of paintings of 'mr mittens'. Disturbing i tell you.

There are a number of face palm moments in game like when a guy in a neighbouring cell just happens to have a stick of dynamite to give you, apparently they are easy to get in an assylum. But there are also many clever moments in the game too, like how you have to stop a dripping tap, and even the shot gun trap at the beginning.

I really liked the music in the game, though repititive, but it really did build the suspense at certain moments. The graphics had its moments, for instance there is one scene where a guy is placed in a wheel chair that disappears and magically reappears after you click on something and when owen is lying in bed you can make his head disappear lol. Don't ask me how, but you can. Hence in some area's it just seemed rushed to get the product finished by maybe a certain dead line. What further makes me feel this way is the fact that there are no rewards for the person after they have finished. No secret room, no prequel little adventure, no photo gallery, no behind the scenes gift. Nothing where the developer says 'THANKYOU' to the customer and fan base.

Instead for those that want 100% achievement rating they will be forced to play the whole thing again and play mahjong instead of hidden objects, and if you have missed certain clues along the way you may be forced to play a 3rd time. This is where the game, since it has very little replay value begins to get tedious. I really wish they would stop doing that.

A lot of people have stated that they found the twists and turns in the plot to be many and they were suprised to find out who the murderer was. REALLY? Seriously I guessed it pretty much straight away. It's not hard to work out that if they say a certain person is the murderer, you can bet your bottom dollar that they aren't. And how hard is it to work out that the murderer is the person NOT dying. Seriously as soon as you show up people start dying everywhere around you. So much so that I was really surprised that none of the characters pointed their finger at me and said, "YOU ARE THE MURDERER". 

While i enjoyed the ending, I did not quite understand what they were trying to say. Were the developers trying to say that some murderers are just misunderstood people and really nice people inside? Oh that's nice to know. Jeffery Dharmer why dont you come around to my house for a BBQ? Lets be friends...

No doubt your curious now, buy the game when it goes on sale...

24020670.review:
Segunda entrega de 9 Clues que no continúa la historia que pudimos ver con anterioridad pero si continúa con los mismos investigadores. En esta ocasión tendremos que viajar a un centro psiquiátrico, manicomio vamos, donde acudimos respondiendo a una llamada desconcertante. A partir de ahí, se sucederán ciertos acontecimientos que nos tendrán más o menos intrigados hasta la resolución de los mismos.

En lo que respecta a su jugabilidad, esta segunda parte es superior a la primera. El sistema deductivo ha sido mejorado y es algo más lógico, así como su método de resolución. Sin embargo, tanto esto como la aventura en general sigue pecando de ser insultantemente fácil. Es cierto que los juegos de HO no son para nada complicados, son ridiculamente fáciles de hecho, pero en cierta manera creo que todo el mundo lo prefiere así  y es lo que se espera de este tipo de género o subgénero según se mire. Para aventuras complicadas o desafiantes ya están las de toda la vida, al menos eso creo yo. En sí mismo, este tipo de juegos son para disfrutarlos sin complicaciones y 9 Clues 2 cumple su función en este aspecto perfectamente.

En su vertiente de puzles podremos encontrar los típicos juegos de buscar objetos, aunque también podremos sustituirlo por un sistema de juego de Majhong, así como puzles de diverso tipo bastante originales basados en la lógica y que en muchos casos ya nos sonarán de otros HO pero aportando sus propias características, lo cual es de agradecer. 

También hay que destacar que la traducción al español está bien realizada, para variar, y no nos encontraremos palabras que no tienen nada que ver con lo que estamos buscando. Algo fundamental en este tipo de juegos.

Sin embargo, lo único en lo que considero que esta segunda parte es inferior a su primera es en el argumento, y más concretamente el tema que trata. El anterior era mucho más interesante y era diametralmente diferente. En este caso no sorprende tanto, nada de hecho, ya que el tema de manicomios está ya un poco visto. Aún así la historia es entretenida aunque sepamos que en este tipo de juegos todo es un tanto "soft". Es decir, la historia cumple pero sabemos que estamos ante algo bastante liviano.

En definitiva, 9 Clues 2 no es ni de lejos el mejor HO que podrás disfrutar, pero también está lejos de ser el peor. Para unas pocas horas cumple y entretiene, que es al fin y al cabo lo que se le pide a un HO, ¿no?

23604391.review:
9 Clues 2: The Ward to kontynuacja detektywistycznej przygodówki, osadzonej w Ameryce w latach pięćdziesiątych. W grze ponownie wcielamy się w znaną detektyw, która tym razem wraz z partnerem przybywa odciętą od świata wyspę, mieszczącą ośrodek dla obłąkanych, Mnemosyne Asylum, w celu rozwikłania zagadki tajemniczych morderstw. Zaraz po przybyciu bohaterka jest świadkiem kolejnej, tragicznej śmierci. Kim jest tajemniczy morderca? Czy zabójstwa mają związek z pożarem, który kilka lat wcześniej pochłonął część placówki razem ze znajdującymi się w niej ludźmi? Jakie inne mroczne sekrety skrywa Mnemosyne Asylum?

Pierwsze 9 Clues osadzone było w mrocznym klimacie, okraszonym elementami fantastycznymi. W drugiej części zrezygnowano z owych motywów fantastycznych, a ciemne kolory zostały zastąpione nieco jaśniejszymi tonami. I przyznam, że ta zmiana przypadła mi do gustu. Szpitalne lokacje w połączeniu z ciekawą i pełną zwrotów akcji fabułą dobrze budują atmosferę grozy i niepewności. Oprawa wizualna gry stoi na przyzwoitym poziomie, choć lepiej mogłyby wyglądać animacje postaci. Szczególnie w oczy rażą twarze bohaterów, niepasujące do reszty ich ciał.

Pod względem rozgrywki jednak gra nie różni się za bardzo od swojej poprzedniczki. Jest to dość typowa, casualowa HOPA, czyli pierwszoosobowa, klikana przygodówka, kładąca duży nacisk na odnajdywanie ukrytych przedmiotów i rozwiązywanie łamigłówek logicznych. Casualowa dlatego, iż gracz podczas przechodzenia poszczególnych etapów produkcji może skorzystać z szeregu podpowiedzi i ułatwień. Dodatkowo gracze nieprzepadający za sekwencjami, w których na zatłoczonym ekranie muszą odnajdywać wskazane przedmioty, mogą w ramach alternatywy układać mahjonga. Jedynym elementem wyróżniającym 9 Clues 2 od innych produkcji tego typu jest tryb detektywistyczny, choć w sumie nie tak daleko mu do klasycznych sekwencji ukrytych obiektów. Gra nie należy do specjalnie wymagających, jak zresztą prawie wszystkie tego typu produkcje. Wyjątkowo łatwe wydały mi się sekwencje ukrytych obiektów, choć nie znaczy to, że są one słabo wykonane. Nie są, choć ich poziom trudności mógłby być trochę wyższy. Przedmioty są ładnie narysowane i nieźle poukrywane. Całkiem dobrze zaprojektowano też zagadki logiczne, dzięki czemu grę przechodzi się prosto i przyjemnie.

Pierwszą część serii charakteryzowało nienajlepsze spolszczenie. Jego autorzy wyraźnie nie wiedzieli, jak posługiwać się przecinkami i apostrofami. Widać, że przed tłumaczeniem 9 Clues 2 wzięli kilka lekcji polskiego, ale i tak zdarzyło im się kilka wpadek. Poza tym zdarza się, iż wyświetlane u góry ekranu komunikaty przysłaniają sceny ukrytych obiektów i po prostu musimy wtedy czekać, aż znikną. Natrafiłem też na jednego, zabawnego i na szczęście tylko graficznego buga. I to dwa razy, bo niestety grę trzeba przejść dwukrotnie, jeśli chce się zdobyć wszystkie osiągnięcia. Ukończenie przygody to zabawa na około trzy godziny. Nie miałbym nic przeciwko, gdyby była dłuższa, ale nie w ten sposób...

Podsumowując, 9 Clues 2: The Ward to po prostu dobra HOPA. Niewymagająca, przyjemna i nastrojowa przygodówka z ładną grafiką i ciekawą fabułą. Dla fanów gatunku jak najbardziej do polecenia.

23484390.review:
[b]Overview[/b]

A solid Hidden Object Game that focuses more on the story and less on Hidden Object Puzzles.

[b]Positive[/b] (good features)[list]
[*]Fairly decent story that does not involve magic or kidnapping (+1).
[*]The story pulls off a decent twist (+0,4).
[*]It's usually logical what you have to do next without checking the map for available actions (+0,5).
[*]Achievements that motivate you not to use hints/skipping (+0,5)
[*]Steam achievements (+0,1).
[*]There's a bunch of different bonus objects to find (+0,1).
[*]German names are correctly pronounced (+0,1).
[/list] 
[b]Neutral[/b] (average/expected features)[list]
[*]Decent music.
[*]Fair mix of puzzles with only a few overused/annoying ones.
[*]The voice-acting is ok.
[*]Little to no illogical solutions.
[/list]
[b]Negative[/b] (bad features)[list]
[*]Poor graphics, especially for something published by Artifex Mundi (-1).
[*]Annoying wobbly effect on characters to simulate movement (-0,1).
[*]A bit on the short side, i finished it in less than 2,5 hours without hints/skipping (-0,2).
[*]The bad guy has red eyes (-0,1)
[*]There's a German psychiatrist (-0,1).
[*]Your character casually hands over her gun to a triple murderer (-0,3).
[*]Virtually no bonus features (-0,2).
[/list]
[b]Conclusion[/b]

Aside from the dated graphics the game has few flaws. It's nice to have a HOG where the story isn't an afterthought. Gameplay overall has a nice flow to it.

[b]Details[/b][list][*]Experience with genre: Extensive (20+ games).
[*]Rating: 6,4
[*]Recommended to: Fans of HOGs and casual story/puzzle/adventure games.
[/list]

23136294.review:
依然是各位喜闻乐见的AM社作品，有中文，质量比一代好一些，但在他家作品里依然算一般水平，个人打分大概是6.5/10的样子。话说AM社作品个人觉得都差不多，真要说哪些相对好的话，推荐天鹅新娘那部和戴维琼斯系列。

尽管是系列第二部，但本作和前作剧情上毫无关系，真要说有什么联系的话也就是给一代收了个尾（顺便说一下，一代最终Boss被官方发了蛇精病便当）。本作的故事倒是没有一代那么神棍，简单说女主应邀去了个荒岛上的精神病院调查杀人事件，最后发现是个复仇的狗血故事。剧情本身没什么创意，真假凶手的设定和最后的逆转有点小意思，别的也就没了。

画面和音乐依然是AM社的一贯风格，中规中矩。

解谜部分需要特殊说一下。9 Clues系列最大的特点就是有相当一部分谜题需要在场景中寻找9个线索推导案发过程，很多隐藏寻物成就也和9相关。和一代相比，本作的9线索部分稍微增加了一点难度，不仅需要从场景中找到线索，而且需要把它们按特定顺序排列起来。寻物和小游戏部分相对简单，尽管有不少限时成就，但游戏中放水的谜题也是异常的多，对解谜老手而言一周目最高难度3h通关问题不大。唯一恶心的一点是本作的寻物也增加了麻将小游戏，导致全成就必须二周目，不过从另一方面来说……嗯，总有寻物过不去的人嘛。

总的来说，本作和一代一样，是个没必要特别买，有了的话玩一下也可以的游戏。游戏有卡有成就，成就很好刷。

22956311.review:
The game's not the best hidden object game I've ever played, but it's far from the worst. To break it down quickly:

~It's a little bit darker than your standard HOG, but that's not a terrible thing. It doesn't go overboard with, say, gore but it doesn't just hint at something bad happening in another room.

~The puzzles are somewhat simple to keep them from being time-consuming. Players who don't mind spending time on complex puzzles will be disappointed, They tend to be the same puzzles we've seen from Artifex Mundi -- this could be either good or bad depending on your personal view. I will warn that it seems like the hidden object aspect takes a backseat here, though.

~They pad the play time out with extra things you can find just walking around. I don't mind collecting extra pictures and things, but you never know when an area will become unaccessible due to plot. If you don't find the object before then, you just won't get it so heads up.

~The plot is bloated with so much extra crap that I think it actually falls through in the end. It's hard for a HOG to get players really invested in plot because the puzzles usually take center stage, but they try to expand it way too much. The big reveals are confusing and convoluted, the circumstances are strange and unlikely, they try to force-feed you character development that's not earned...there's just so many issues that could be resolved by shaving the plot down.

Despite the flaws, I did have some fun. I would heartily recommend not buying it unless it's on sale, as I don't feel it justifies the full price. However, if you like Artifex Mundi's games and usually have no issues with them, give it a shot either way.

When it comes to HOG games I have a love/hate relationship with them:
 Sometimes they can be way too easy and uninspired, sometimes the art is blocking the gameplay (objects are indistinguishable in the clutter), sometimes the overall art-style is not my cup-o'- tea and sometimes the story is lame and the puzzles idiotic. 
 Here with this game '9 clues: The Ward' all this has been done just right and the gameplay is therefore extremely enjoyable. Of course there's still the awkward moment when you can't unscrew a bold with the knife you have but the vile that you find later will do the trick just fine .... but that is not interfering with the great pacing of the game and the many lovely touches that make this more than a HOG. 
The Ward could rightfully be called a detective game with some hidden object puzzles.  After playing some mediocre or downright bad HOG's I almost gave up on the genre.  This game makes me glad I didn't.

21863064.review:
9 Clues 2: The Ward is Artifex Mundi jumping the proverbial shark.

Though their library isn’t quite the flawless lineup their “premium” branding would have you believe, by and large Artifex Mundi’s hidden-object adventure games (referred to henceforth as HOGs) hit far more than they miss, especially given the fact that they seem to release half a dozen of them in any given month. They consistently manage to strike that perfect balance between above average production values, simple but enjoyable puzzle designs, and storylines just earnest enough to be entertaining. The first 9 Clues game, Secret of Serpent Creek (credited to Tap It Games, but so indistinguishable from Artifex Mundi’s own games that the distinction between them as developer or publisher seems a moot point), continues to rank as my favorite HOG to date, taking all the tenants of Artifex Mundi’s trademark design and wrapping them up into a lighthearted but endearing mystery thriller.

Though it shares the same series, The Ward is not only a dramatic departure from the previous 9 Clues but from Artifex Mundi’s HOGs in general. The Ward can best be summed up as Artifex Mundi going through a phase of overwhelming teen angst. Cue the inexplicable violence. Cue the barely intelligible plotlines designed for MAXIMUM DRAMA. Cue the misunderstood sociopath who was only murdering people because another sociopath told them to (it’s OK though, they’re actually good, I swear, so let’s just forget all that murder business).

If Secret of Serpent Creek was trying to be Scooby-doo, The Ward wants to be Shutter Island. It’s aggressively grim and (for a HOG) shockingly grotesque in both its story beats and how little it hesitates to delve headfirst into the most disturbing of subject matter. And this is where The Ward lost me. Even before its narrative turned into a convoluted mush of character reversals, deus ex machinas, and astoundingly convenient circumstances (again, even for HOG standards), The Ward alienated me with how little it cared. Where past Artifex Mundi games verged upon the repugnantly earnest, The Ward is a melting pot of “mature” themes and purposeless cruelty handled with even less care than you’d expect from this style of game. I’m not sure if The Ward came from a place unsatisfied with the casual branding of HOGs or if Artifex Mundi just ran out of ideas and started scrubbing through horror films for inspiration, but the second 9 Clues has managed to eject every ounce of the first game’s charm and replaced it with a nauseatingly poor attempt at tackling “adult” themes.

It’s all downhill from there, as the narrative flounders around attempting to find itself, puzzles become more obscure and tedious, and a veritable cornucopia of bad accents meander through lines as if the voice actors are simultaneously bored and learning to read for the first time. I even ran into some graphical bugs, which apart from being the most amusing part of the game cement how thrown together The Ward feels. I suppose it was bound to happen eventually that Artifex Mundi would release a colossal dud given the speed of their production process, but with how much I loved the first 9 Clues I’m sad that The Ward had to be the one to break the formula. The Ward exists then as a reminder of why we can’t have nice things. Only exploitative representations of mental illness and thoughtless depictions of suicide. Try not to cut yourself on all this edge.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2016/03/15/quick-thoughts-on-9-clues-the-ward/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

21762412.review:
玩了这么多解谜游戏，这是我遇到的唯一一个游戏选项菜单中有个选项是“立即评分”的，点了就直接跳到steam的写评测页面。看来游戏制作者对自己的游戏非常满意和自信嘛。
不过他的自信是有道理的，这个游戏的确做得很棒。这部是九条线索蛇溪镇那部的续作，所以游戏场景里挂着一些蛇溪镇的画，让我看着非常高兴。不过这部和上部的故事并没有联系，虽然男女主角还是第一部的。只是游戏中有那么一本书说了句上一部的BOSS被当成精神病了。而且也一改第一部的不明生物、古代神器风，开始走比较科学的写实风。
这部的小游戏虽然种类和数量较少，但隐藏物品谜题没有因此而变得特别多（比如像翡翠少女、木偶那俩几乎没小游戏硬生生靠隐藏物体谜题把游戏时间拉长的）。而且强化了麻将系统，以前玩麻将如果手滑点到了不配对的麻将，他会先提示你点错了，然后你才能点其他的麻将。虽然这个提示并没有文字而且只持续一秒左右，但还是让人非常不爽。这部就取消了这种提示，如果你点到了不配对的麻将，会直接将你点到的不配对的那个麻将设定为下一次配对的第一个（不知道我这语言表达的清不清楚）。
9条线索系列的一个亮点即是侦探系统（我不记得学名是不是叫这个）。我玩过许多这类的解谜游戏，里面许多的女主角都是侦探，然而说是侦探但是从始至终也只会找东西。唯一像侦探的俩也就乌鸦森林之谜系列的女主和9条线索的女主了。乌鸦森林之谜的女主是四处捡物证然后贴墙上整理和推断，9条线索的女主是通过观察房间来推断出这个房间之前发生了什么，也就是侦探系统。这才是侦探该有的能力嘛。比起上一代的在房间中找到线索后就能自动进行排列和推理，这代找出线索之后需要玩家自己进行顺序的排列。虽然玩家是靠线索的图标背景图案来排列的，但好歹也是有个排列过程嘛，显得更加真实一些。
剧情方面，整个故事一波三折，联系很紧密，而且有种一点点拨开云雾看到真相的感觉，很不错。因为涉及到大幅的剧透，所以我就不再继续说了。
顺便提一下游戏中的两个片段。第一个是男主角在屋顶晕倒了，女主角为了叫醒他上去啪一个耳光就给扇醒了。这一耳光扇的我感动不已，玩了这么多解谜游戏，遇到这么多昏迷的情况，女主角终于用了最简单最直接最快捷的方法把人叫醒，而不是千里迢迢的去找嗅盐或是水桶。这是人类的进步，是时代的进步！！！！
另一个是女主角在逃出病房时，骨刀掉到了楼下。他们完全可以直接设定刚才用完骨刀之后骨刀直接消失（其实他们其他道具都是这么设定的），但他们还是做了个在挪动时骨刀不小心掉到了楼下，来解释为啥回到屋子之后骨刀没掉了。虽然并没有什么太大的卵用，但是好歹证明制作人员还是有心去解决这个“用完就扔”的设定的。
还有一个细节，就是游戏中的那个催眠小木偶。第一次遇到木偶是必须要拉的，不拉就不能得到物品就不能推动剧情。这个是肯定的，毕竟女主角并不知道那个木偶会催眠，而且被催眠了才能有后面那些发生的事。但是往后几次遇到其他木偶，就可以选择拉，也可以选择不拉。不拉的话并不会影响后面剧情的发展（虽然女主角仍旧不知道那个木偶会催眠）。这个设定非常好，至少不会显的女主角像傻瓜，中招一次不够还要在同一个地方摔倒第二次第三次第四次。不像有其他的解谜游戏，你明知道自己这么干会出事，可是不这么作死游戏就不能继续，让人非常不爽。

21753784.review:
[h1][u]Game Information[/u][/h1]

9 Clues: The Ward, is a HOPA* game, developed by Tap It Games and published by Artifex Mundi.

This is the second installment of the series. The previous installment was 9 Clues: The Secret of Serpent Creek.

*HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

[h1][u]Game Visuals[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the option menu.

[h1][u]Game Audio[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even if it's simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the option menu as well.

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]

There are only three difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual, Advanced and Expert.

The game is divided up into acts. There are total eight of acts in the game.

Diary Notebook it has three sections. Game Objectives, Clues and Characters.

There is an option for locking the inventory in place. It's automatically lock in place at the start of the game.

The interactive map allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates there are tasks that needs to be done at certain locations. 

Most of the game's hidden object scenes consists of traditional word lists with some or no interaction.

Mahjong mini game is optional for anyone who doesn't want to go looking for the items in the hidden object scenes.

Most of the game's puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There are collectibles (sorta) in the game. Asylum Model Fragments, Hidden Clues and Phantom Objects.

There are thirty-nine different achievements. But each of these achievements has certain requirements before they can be unlocked.

[h1][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/h1]

There are total of six different trading cards. You only get the three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and it's Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts, I've found this game enjoyable to certain extend. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the full price.

20543342.review:
Następna z kolei produkcja rodzimego studia Artifex Mundi, po którą sięgnąłem. Muszę przyznać, że jak dotąd najbardziej przypadła mi do gustu, głównie za sprawą specyficznego klimatu szpitala psychiatrycznego znajdującego się na odizolowanej przez sztorm wyspie (co łudząco przypomina miejsce akcji filmu Shutter Island). Ambientowa muzyka, dobiegające nas niepokojące odgłosy, ciemne i zaniedbane szpitalne pomieszczenia oraz strugi deszczu za oknem  - to wszystko składa się na atmosferę gry. Pod względem graficznym nie mam nic do zarzucenia - scenerie są jak zwykle estetyczne, dopracowane i z duża ilością detali. Jedynie animacje mogłyby być zrobione lepiej, ale można na to przymknąć oko.

Jak już ktoś w swojej recencji wspomniał, dużą zaletą jest to, że są to wątki raczej kriminalne, niż związane z nadprzyrodzonymi mocami, jak to w pozostałych grach AF bywa, co powinno przypaść do gustu fanom tego typu literatury, (choć nie należy zbyt wiele wymagać od 3-4 godzinnej gry). Nie wdając się w zbędne spoilery, jestem jednak miło zaskoczony opowiedzianą historią, ponieważ w kilku miejscach potrafiła mnie zaskoczyć. A początkowo byłem do tego sceptycznie nastawiony i spodziewałem się większego banału. Czyli pod tym względem również wypada lepiej, niż niektóre z pozostałych gier tego typu. 

Z góry uprzedzam - nie ma to nic wspólnego z horrorem, co mógłby sugerować opis. Nie uświadczymy tu żadnego scare jumpa, gra nie próbuje nas w żaden sposób na siłę wystraszyć, co dla mnie jest akurat zaletą, ale ktoś szukających mocniejszych wrażeń raczej się zawiedzie. 

Gra jest idealna do wieczornego relaksu przed ekranem. Mimo tego, że zagadek jest całkiem sporo i są zróżnicowane (oprócz klasycznego hidden objects nie znajdziemy tu dwa razy zagadki tego samego typu) to gra jest stosunkowo prosta i wymaga niewielkiego zaangażowania od gracza. Możemy dzięki temu szybko postępować naprzód w fabule, bez konieczności długotrwałego główkowania nad pojedynczym zadaniem.
Bardzo casualowe doświadczenie :D

Ogólnie z zakupu gry jestem zadowolony, polecam na któryś z zimnych i deszczowych wieczorów, gdy nie będzie żadnej książki pod ręką :)

20534765.review:
Their portrayal of hypnosis was ridiculous - not only does it NOT work the way they portrayed it, it was just a huge trope of the Evil Mind Control bit. 

Something that I really didn't like was that the story was betrayed through hints from your surroundings, i.e. clicking on objects gives you a bit of information and sometimes it'd say things that didn't happen yet story-wise. 

The story itself was kinda predictable (I figured out the twist ending from the beginning), and at some points scattered so that made it less interesting / less of a drive to play. 
I noticed this in other Artifex Mundi games as well. They don't fully explain what's going on (e.g. you suddenly reach a conclusion that the story interactions didn't properly lead up to) and the way to figure out what the story is supposed to be is by reading your "Journal" (which should only be there for reminders - not for actually explaining the story because they failed to do so properly in the gameplay)!

20447160.review:
プレイ時間：3時間半（クリア済み）

ストーリー：★★★
難易度：★★☆
BGM：★★☆

Artifex Mundi製のアイテム探しゲーム(Hidden Object)。
2ということで続きもののように思えるけれど単に主人公が同じなだけなので1未プレイでも大丈夫です。

舞台は50年台のアメリカ。
主人公の女探偵とそのパートナーが、とある孤島にある精神病棟より助けを求める電話を受け調査に乗り出します。
主人公たちが孤島に着いた途端に起きる殺人事件、そして病棟に勤める者たちが何か隠そうとしている過去…、この２つを上手く絡めたストーリーとなっていて、なかなか先を楽しみながらプレイできました。

アイテム探しとしてはそこまで意地悪なものもなく、難易度としては中ぐらい。お決まりのパズルもちょこちょこありますが、これもそこまで難しいものはなく、定番のものばかりなので、箸休めに楽しく進めることが出来るでしょう。

あとはアイテム探しゲーとしては異質な、アイテム探し面倒な人向けに「牌合わせゲーム」なるものがあり、この「牌合わせ」をクリアすることでアイテム探しをスキップすることが出来ます（アイテム探しメインなのにそんなことしてええんかい！って突っ込むところなんですよね？ですよね！！）。

その他ストーリーの進行には関係ない隠しアイテム（実績に関わる）もあり、ストーリー・BGM共に良く、やりごたえのあるゲームだと思います。チュートリアルもかなり親切な方なのでアイテム探しゲーム未プレイな方にもおすすめ。

注意としてはオートセーブなのでゲームをクリアしてしまうと隠しアイテム探しも一からになっちゃうので、その辺気になる方はWalkthroughなど見つつプレイするのが良いかも。
